name: The Royal Horseguards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have stayed here many times now and always look forward to returning. It is perfectly placed for Whitehall and Parliament and if you can get a room overlooking the river the views are unrivalled. This time the room had views out to the West over St James's Park. Great people, from the doorman through to reception, to the concierge and beyond - they make a great team. Location, hospitality, great rooms - all you can ask really.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Royal Horseguards Hotel for the second time in two years. It is still a wonderful hotel. I enjoyed my stay there and would go back for a third visit. It is conveniently located near the River Thames, the Parliament Buildings, Westminster Abbey, Big Ben, Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace. All are very short walking distances away. And for places you cannot walk to, the Embankment Tube station is just around the corner with 4 lines that can take you anywhere in London. Don't forget to purchase an Oyster Card to ride the tube. The Oyster card is pay as you go and very convenient for travellers. If you run out of funds you simply go to a machine and top up your funds with cash or credit card. Unused funds can be refunded back to you when you finish your stay. Simply go to one of the tube stations and speak with an employee to get your unused funds back from your Oyster Card. Now back to the hotel, The hotel itself is clean, large, and staff friendly and helpful. The bed is very comfortable. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay at the Royal Horseguards. It is a bit pricey, but if you want a good hotel in a great location, it is worth the price. Look for deals online for best prices.
reviews.title: Still a great hotel...love the location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Royal Horseguards Hotel for our 30th Wedding anniversary trip. 4 nights in London; 4 nights in Paris. I was perfectly happy with the Horseguards Hotel...(and I am one picky hotel guest). The service was top notch and the rooms were very well appointed with great amenities. I think my favorite thing about the hotel was its location. Big cities can be very wearing after a day or two...and you seem to need a little relief from it all. This hotel's location on the Thames River was just the ticket. We were just across the river from the London Eye...and the view of the river (we requested and paid for the river view) truly soothed our over-stimulated spirits at the end of a day of sight-seeing. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: One of my favorite hotel experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my favourite hotel in London. All the comforts you could wish for. Plenty of space, excellent bathrooms, very clean and well decorated. Pure luxury. As others have said it comes at a price but book with one of the offers and it is well worth it.
reviews.title: Overnight in London in comfort & style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Four days in London with the intention of visiting as many galleries, the Thames, historical and ecclesiatical sites and getting to know Central London better. What was needed? A good hotel right in the middle of it all. Royal Horseguards is just that. Situated on the Victoria Embankment opposite the London Eye, it could not have been better placed.
reviews.title: The Hotel on the Thames

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love staying here, and do. Right in the heart of London, nice rooms if on the inside, and great rooms if on the outside. My favorite rooms are along the Thames side, big, well decorated, well equipped.
reviews.title: Location, Service, Refinement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Breakfast here is a delightful way to start your day, even if you're not staying here. A bit posh, a bit reserved, and veddy English.
reviews.title: Good location and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Enjoy!
reviews.title: Meal at the 121 resturant in Royal Horseguards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night as it is in walking distance of Waterloo Station and easy to find.
reviews.title: THE BEST HOTEL IN LONDON

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: This is a classic London hotel and situated on the north embankment. Great location - walking distance to Trafalgar Square, Parliament Square, London Eye, Covent Garden, Charing Cross and the Embankment Tube.
reviews.title: Hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently in London for business but extended it and invited my spouse for a weekend getaway. Lovely river view directly across from the London Eye. Spectacular views at night! The room was spacious and very well appointed. The hotel restaurant offered a classic and indulgent breakfast and a classic high tea complete with live harp. We indulged in a late night drink in the bar -- Earl Grey Martinis hit the spot! Courteous staff.
reviews.title: Lovely, romantic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here for work for one night. I absolutely loved it! The hotel is in a fabulous majestic building with an amazing history, on the banks of the Thames. I was given an amazing room overlooking the river and the London Eye. I cannot tell you how lovely it was. One of the best rooms I ever stayed in, spacious, confortable beds, great bathroom amenities. Overall a great 5 star treatment. Worth the stay, and you can get some great value for the money.
reviews.title: Really excellent location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luxurious, high-class hotel. Having a T.V in the bath is particularly indulgent. Lovely breakfast, excellent location. Only thing that was disappointing was evening meal. We decided to have room service and my meal was very bland so I'd recommend staying here but eat dinner at one of the nearby restaurants.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: We stayed here on the recommendation of a friend for a function in January. The service was excellent. Booked a double room & found it to be more than your average double room. Views over the Thames at night towards The London Eye, County Hall & The Royal Festval Hall were great. Recommend dinner at Skylon. Linens & toiletries of a superior quality. Staff could not be for helpful. Would thoroughly recommend the hotel. We'll definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Truly decadent in a fantastic location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Treated ourselves to a Saturday night at this superb hotel after spotting a good deal on late rooms. The location is excellent, right on the embankment and, having a river view room,meant a cracking view of the London Eye. The room itself was compact, cosy and beautifully furnished with every detail considered from underfloor heating in the bathroom to the iPod dock by the bed. The staff were friendly , professional and welcoming and although the breakfast came with a substantial price tag, it was worth every penny. An excellent hotel worthy of its five star rating and although pricey, it is definitely worth splashing out on a a treat. Thank you Royal Horseguards, we will be back :-)
reviews.title: Royal treatment with a smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our base for a long, busy and excellent weekend in London. It is in a superb location, very close to Embankment underground Station and Waterloo Station. Also easy walk to Charringcross and theatreland. The Hotel was spotless, our room was brilliant with a view over the River Thames. Breakfast was to die for. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. One note of caution be wary of the price of the drinks.
reviews.title: A 5 star hotel in a 5 star location
Excellent stay!
reviews.text: This was my base for my friends wedding in London. It was in an excellent location and only a short journey from Waterloo Station. From start to finish it was a quality and luxurious stay. Quiet but real quality. Staff were excellent. I had a compact but very well appointed room. My room rate included the breakfast buffet which was lovely. I only wish I had more time on the day of the wedding to enjoy it further, definitely worth having. I only hope i can stay here again on another trip to London...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel has a very nice location and can be easily reached by public transportation. A taxi is however the easiest and cheap way from the Victoria station if your flight arrived at Gatwick. Ten minutes walk to Piccadilly Circus and even less to Leicester Square, so you easy access to pubs, restaurants, theatres and practically everything.
reviews.title: All excellent but everything has its price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is excellent and rooms are spacious, the location is quiet, all very important in my opinion.
reviews.title: location, atmosphere, London - a perfect match

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I spent only one night and did not have more than 6 hours to sleep just because of my tight business schedule. Even so, I was happy with the hotel choice.
reviews.title: Location excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here as part of a tour package. Lovely hotel, beautiful room, if a bit small for three of us (in our own twin beds), but that's Europe! Great food in the hotel restaurant, and fantastic location near the river, tube, etc. The bathroom was stellar - heated towel rack, and heated floors, which are grand after wandering in the rain and wind. Quiet spot near to lots of sights.
reviews.title: Lovely Place to Stay in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Gorgeous hotel. Conveniently located 5 minute (if that) walk from embankment tube station. 10 minute walk to covent garden. Easy to find. Staff couldn't be more helpful. We stayed in room 717. A deluxe double. Though it was a beautifully decorated and clean room with lovely free elemis products and a tv in the bathroom it was a little small. Very comfy beds. Service was impeccable. Definitely recommend to others. I will definitely be returning but only for a special occasion due to the price
reviews.title: Lovely lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, but also quiet. Staff friendly and welcoming, with lots offers to help. Good sized room for a standard with comfortable bed. Everything in excellant state of decor and clean. Got good deal and got more than I paid for. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Best Hotel stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights on business. It's a very good hotel and the location is great. Rooms are large and have all things you need. So absolutely no complaints; it is all that can but also should be expected from this kind of hotel.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, great location, bit pricy though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: This does however come at a price, and personally I am not sure if the value for money is all that great.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel in a great location
Disappointing
reviews.text: I have mixed feelings writing about this hotel. There are positive points about it: it's doormen service that would welcome you and take care of you luggage straight from your taxi. Then, the general ambiance, lobby and bars that give you a warm feeling. The breakfast room spacious and nice, there is a quick service there and a good choice of cold and hot dishes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But then other elements come to the picture: the check-in and check-out was lengthy and painful. My first night was prepaid at a special rate on the hotel's website while the 2 following nights were booked directly with the hotel at the conference rates. When after 10 min of waiting I got to the check-in desk, I was told that my 2 conference night were cancelled by conference organizer. It took 50 mouse clicks and my black on white reservation confirmation by the hotel to get room key. I was told I can stay in the same room 3 nights without changing, which usually means I was put directly to my Double Delux Room (£ 270 per night incl breakfast). My room (906) was ok till I noticed that the windows were blind, when trying to understand the reason I saw that I had a view on the wall and turbo ventilators fixed on this wall. I immediately asked reception for a change and received opposite room (905) with the view on the roofs ( £ 270 per night does not seem to be enough to see the river) and extremely noisy airconditioning/heating. As a result, tired with previous changes, I slept all the nights with ear plugs. Other than this, the room was correct as you would expect of a standard room (not of a deluxe room) with a comfortable bed and a bathroom with heated floor / towel racks. There was also a free Wifi that worked well.
reviews.title: customer service with style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My check out took again 15 min as my bill was showing extra positions to the prepaid night and discussion with 2 receptionists that seem to ignore what these positions were, was lengthy. The arguments of group booking came back like boomerang making me at 6.30 am angry to start the day. Pity.
reviews.title: Great Location on the Thames

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Should I have again a conference at this hotel, I would stay elsewhere and commute!
reviews.title: Great Hotel If You Can Get A Good Rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as a weekend treat having got a good deal with a prior booking.The moment we approached the main entrance we were met with courteousness in abundence ,all staff have very polished standards as to how to provide excellent customer service without being patronising.The downstairs lobby and generally provides for an oppulent and luxuriant experience ,some hotels rest on their laurels when it comes to their 5 star status ,not this ,it pushes the boundaries. So impressed we upgraded to deluxe double ,worth it for the comfort all detailed in other reviews,With cocktails in the equus bar and dinner later in the one twenty one two restaurant both of which were absolute treats we certainly felt pampered.
reviews.title: A lark and a laugh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked two nights at £155 per night including a room upgrade and a trip up the river. Allocated a room on the eighth floor with a splendid view across the river to the London Eye. Room was a decent size, well equipped viz good towels, high quality cotton sheets, bathrobes etc. Bathroom included a TV in the shower on which, unfortunately for the novelty, the sound did not work. Breakfasts were excellent whether from the buffet or made to order and the tables were a good size with very good linen.
reviews.title: Excelent sevice and breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at 11a.m. and expected to have to leave our baggage with the concierge. We were thus delighted to be given a prepared room straight away. On the day of departure we left our baggage with the concierge and spent the day touring before returning to collect. The location just off Whitehall was perfect for our touring. We went to most venues on foot but the presence of the Embankment Tube Stn just a couple of hundred yards away was a great advantage too. We happily recommend this hotel at this price.
reviews.title: Quiet location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We usually stay at the sister Charing Cross hotel but on this occasion it was full, and so we chose this hotel, and what a pleasant stay we had. The location is quiet but within walking distance of London sites, and theatreland. The rooms are comfortable, and any requests from housekeeping arrived promptly. We did not eat in the restaurant, but service in the bar was excellent. Would definately be come back.
reviews.title: Beautiful building, lovely room, shame about the details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for one night a few days ago. The public areas are sumptuous and welcoming (the live harp music being a pleasant touch) and my room was a good size with a bed that was refreshingly firm. Unfortunately, things were let down by an accumulation of small (and otherwise) details.
reviews.title: Perfect for London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite being advertised, there was no ironing board, iron, or bathrobe in the room (and my request for the last was met with "I'll see what I can do" from the receptionist, which turned out to be nothing).
reviews.title: Theatre Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good hotel in a very good location - very convenient for all the tourist sights of London. Attractive dining terrace with view of the Thames. Rooms pretty much standard 4 star but fine. Breakfast a little disappointing in both choice and quality but overall a decent place to stay for a night or two.
reviews.title: Well Located & Well Presented

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Each year I choose a different hotel in London for afternoon tea which is listed in the London Tea Guild Awards. This year I chose the Royal Horseguards on the Embankment. The menu choices and food were comparable to other hotels, such as the Ritz and the Dorchester, but the setting was quieter and more relaxing. Despite set serving times we did not feel rushed in any way as we did at Brown's where people were queuing at the door for a table. It also offers a patio area for eating but it was raining the day we went. In addition the staff were efficient without encroaching on our space and time. I highly recommend this hotel for afternoon tea.
reviews.title: A tea time treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Service culture needs attention. Patchy, variable. Front desk phone answered with alarming irregularity, if at all on occasions.
reviews.title: Nice. Could do better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: items requested via housekeeping either late or forgotten.
reviews.title: Great location and good room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Quality of room meets five star expectations. Food and dining excellent.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel!

description: Hotel in historic Victorian building converted to Hotel in 1972.
